comment.text: Substrate recognition component of a SCF (SKP1-CUL1-F-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex which mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins involved in cell cycle progression, signal transduction and transcription. Specifically recognizes phosphorylated CDKN1B/p27kip and is involved in regulation of G1/S transition. Degradation of CDKN1B/p27kip also requires CKS1. Recognizes target proteins ORC1, CDT1, RBL2, KMT2A/MLL1, CDK9, RAG2, FOXO1, UBP43, and probably MYC, TOB1 and TAL1. Degradation of TAL1 also requires STUB1. Recognizes CDKN1A in association with CCNE1 or CCNE2 and CDK2. Promotes ubiquitination and destruction of CDH1 in a CK1-Dependent Manner, thereby regulating cell migration.
Through the ubiquitin-mediated proteasomal degradation of hepatitis C virus non-structural protein 5A, has an antiviral activity towards that virus.

Part of a SCF(SKP2) complex consisting of CUL1, RBX1, SKP1 and SKP2. Component of a SCF(SKP2)-like complex containing CUL1, SKP1, TRIM21 and SKP2. Interacts directly with CUL1 and SKP1. Interacts with CKS1. Interacts with the cyclin-A-CDK2 complex. Interacts with ORC1, phosphorylated CDT1, phosphorylated RBL2, ELF4, phosphorylated RAG2, FOXO1, UBP43, MYC, TOB1, TAL1 and KMT2A/MLL1. Interacts with TRIM21. Interacts with IFI27; promotes the ubiquitin-mediated proteasomal degradation of NS5A (PubMed:27194766). Interacts with hepatitis C virus/HCV non-structural protein NS5A; promotes the ubiquitin-mediated proteasomal degradation of NS5A (PubMed:27194766).
Ubiquitinated by the APC/C complex, leading to its degradation by the proteasome. Deubiquitinated by USP13.
Acetylation at Lys-68 and Lys-71 increases stability through impairment of APC/C-mediated proteolysis and promotes cytoplasmic retention. Deacetylated by SIRT3.

property.value: APC/C:Cdh1 mediated degradation of Cdc20 and other APC/C:Cdh1 targeted proteins in late mitosis/early G1
Cyclin D associated events in G1
Regulation of RUNX2 expression and activity
Aberrant regulation of mitotic exit in cancer due to RB1 defects
Expressed in oocyte and 242 other tissues
P:G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle
P:G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle
P:positive regulation of intracellular estrogen receptor signaling pathway
P:positive regulation of smooth muscle cell proliferation
P:SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process

feature.description: Mediates interaction with hepatitis C virus non-structural protein NS5A
